subject: phosphor-led-manager: pass led yaml to build
commitMessage:
phosphor-led-manager: pass led yaml to build

phosphor-led-manager has migrated from autotools to meson, and it needs
to be built with the correct led.yaml.
This will check if there's a led.yaml in the order of:
1. where LED_YAML_PATH specifies
2. default path of virtual/phosphor-led-manager-config-native
3. where SRC_URI += puts files to
and copies it to the right location.

Tested:
devtool modify phosphor-led-manager and checked if led.yaml is the
right one.
devtool reset, built the image and checked if led-manager are hosting
the correct led groups on dbus.
tried five different scenarios:
1. don't use phosphor-led-manager at all: yosemitev2
2. use config-native: romulus
3. use config-mrw-native: witherspoon
4. overrides the native path: hr855xg2
5. puts led.yaml in SRC_URI: created a custom one and tested that

Signed-off-by: Seires Li <seiresli@pcpartner.com>
Change-Id: Iacfbe633befd3f50f5ea685fd234a49e0eeb7b6f

Looks ok to me.  Vishwa?
Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 220e194628f8594587d11436b6486da8edeef4b6 by Patrick Williams
I'll remove this part later. Just for a CI build success.
okay.. I will wait for this to be removed to score +1
nit: don't need a space between } and "

sorry I missed this.. I think we leave space in the beginning for all appends. so, it would be 

EXTRA_OEMESON += " -Dtests=disabled -Dled-yaml-path=${STAGING_DATADIR_NATIVE}/${PN}"
Is this applicable anymore ?.. we have the code merged in ledmanager.
This will be able to be merged faster if you put this part in a separate commit.
we just want to make sure this gets merged _BEFORE_ the auto rev bump
I'd prefer we do not include the SRCREV bump here and do it after the automatically generated commit.
Does this actually do anything for the meta-phosphor recipe?  I don't see an obvious -native recipe for which this would do anything.
phosphor-led-manager-config-mrw-native.bb generates led.yaml from mrw xml and outputs to that path. I'm not sure what you mean by doing anything though.

Should this `led-yaml-path` only be set when distro-feature MRW is enabled then?  This is the only reference to phosphor-led-manager-config-mrw I see:

    meta-phosphor/conf/distro/include/phosphor-mrw.inc:PREFERRED_PROVIDER_virtual/phosphor-led-manager-config-native_df-mrw ?= "phosphor-led-manager-config-mrw-native"
phosphor-led-manager-config-example-native_git.bb also uses the path by default

Sure, but that recipe is similarly useless.  All it does is copy the default led.yaml from led-manager's own repository, which it would already use if -Dled-yaml-path isn't set.  Personally, I'd rather have someone's compile fail if they were inadvertently using the canned led.yaml than have this 'config-example' that uses inappropriate data on a machine.

To signal the user that he's using the canned led.yaml, we can remove the led.yaml in phosphor-led-manager so that it would result in a compile error. But that also means that it won't compile on its own when debugging.
How about we keep the compatibility with config-native and add support for SRC_URI, and we remove config-native support when people have stopped using it?
so this means, we don't need led-yaml-path in the meson_options ?. and we can go back to what we had before ?
Yes, after adding the variable here, we no longer need the meson option.
Do we need to modify meson file as well in repo after this patch or that is optional
It's optional. Keeping it doesn't break stuff. Removing it can avoid confusing people and it's a bit less code.
